definition: retroflex final/nonsyllabic final r 儿 added to a word in spoken Chinese
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
nonsyllabic final r 儿 added to a word in spoken Chinese/also called retroflex final or r-ization
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
(Chinese linguistics) zero initial (the initial of a syllable that does not begin with a consonant)
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
main vowel in diphthong
Beijing dialect
bisyllable
retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
velar nasal/consonant ng or ŋ produced in the nose with the back of the tongue against the soft palate
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
phonetic value of a character
suffix
polysyllabic word/Chinese word made up of three or more characters
lateral consonant (phonetics)
